intro: Pavetta macrosepala var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers and hairy foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The leaves are usually ovate to elliptical in shape and may have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs.
